str2: And, even, also, namely.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Agrippa, i.e. Herod Agrippa II. Apparently from agrios and hippos; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: To be present together with. From sun and pareimi; to be at hand together, i.e. Now present.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From en and tugchano; to chance upon, i.e. confer with; by extension to entreat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Here, in this place. From a prolonged form of en; properly, within, i.e. here, hither.
And, even, also, namely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To shout, call aloud, proclaim. Apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. Shout.
Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.
